title: Cascading Failures
description: Agentic systems are deeply interconnected. One bad output, whether a hallucination, malicious input, or poisoned memory, can ripple across multiple agents and workflows. A tiny fault can snowball into system-wide outages that hit confidentiality, integrity, and availability all at once.
detection_patterns: Planner → executor chains with no validation between steps
Persistent memories storing corrupted goals or instructions
Agents acting on poisoned messages from peers
Feedback loops where agents reinforce each other's mistakes
No circuit breakers or containment mechanisms
attack_vectors: A compromised market-analysis agent inflates trading limits → execution agents follow blindly → compliance misses it because actions are 'in policy'
A corrupted healthcare data source updates treatment rules → coordination agents push those harmful protocols system-wide
A remediation agent suppresses alerts to meet SLAs → planning agents misinterpret this as 'system clean,' widening automation and blind spots
Galileo AI Research: Single compromised agent poisoned 87% of downstream decision-making within 4 hours
Manufacturing Procurement Cascade: Agent manipulated over three weeks, approved $5 million in false orders

mitigations.description: Zero-trust design assuming any agent or data source can fail
mitigations.implementation: Design systems with the assumption that any component can be compromised.

mitigations.description: Strong isolation: sandboxes, segmentation, scoped APIs
mitigations.implementation: Isolate agents and workflows to limit blast radius of failures.

mitigations.description: Circuit breakers to stop runaway workflows
mitigations.implementation: Implement circuit breakers that halt workflows when anomalies are detected.

mitigations.description: Independent policy engines separating planning from execution
mitigations.implementation: Separate policy enforcement from agent execution logic.
Maintain immutable, tamper-evident logs of all agent actions.

mitigations.description: Digital-twin replay to test policy changes before rollout
mitigations.implementation: Test cascading scenarios in isolated digital twins before deployment.

mitigations.description: Maintain deep observability into inter-agent communication logs
mitigations.implementation: Monitor and log all inter-agent communication for anomaly detection.

mitigations.description: Define blast-radius caps and containment thresholds
mitigations.implementation: Set limits on how far failures can propagate.

references.title: OWASP Agentic Top 10 - AGENTIC08: Cascading Failures
